text: President Street, in 1912. The Deluge was a fireboat operated, for decades, in Baltimore, Maryland. When built, in 1911, her capacity to pump 12,000 gallons per minute made her one of the most powerful fireboats.Some 21st Century fireboats can pump around 50,000 gallons per minute, four times as much water. In 1917 the Deluge played a key role in fighting a fire at Baltimore's historic Pier 9, that spread to the British freighter She helped fight another fire, in 1917, near a munition plant. ==References== Category:Fireboats of Maryland
title: Deluge (fireboat, 1911)
